c95720c193df40ce1618d1b00b040b42 (12:33): zip: Start every stylesheet with this: * { margin: 0; padding: 0; }. You'll save yourself the confusion over quite a few strange element and browser spacing differences later on.
3c26b6648764f1ab4360aa71da5d760b (12:33): nanana: you get what you pay for. You're not paying, so be thankful you're at least getting links.

e31db85dcb20daa71492f2512e9c50a5 (12:54): I am validating a page on w3c and it say that is an error no align !!! <p align="center">
e31db85dcb20daa71492f2512e9c50a5 (12:54): Line 25 column 15: there is no attribute "ALIGN".
e31db85dcb20daa71492f2512e9c50a5 (12:54): it seem to work so why is a error ?
e31db85dcb20daa71492f2512e9c50a5 (12:55): Line 25 column 15: there is no attribute "ALIGN".
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (12:55): because in the html specs, there is no 'align' attribute
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (12:55): but the browsers implement it anyway
e31db85dcb20daa71492f2512e9c50a5 (12:55): but it work if changed from left to center to right
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (12:56): drop the align attribute and use text-align in the css instead. that'll satisfy the validator and make use of css
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (12:56): what does idem mean anyway?
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (12:57): same situation with the <p>'s align
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (12:57): drop the border attribute and use CSS's border property
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (12:58): you'll find many instances of this issue. and the proper way to deal with it, is to follow the standards and use HTML for markup and CSS for presentation
